description: Get a list of all deployments in your project

data.description: Data is the array of deployment items

args.description: Args are the arguments passed to the container's command

autoscaling.description: Autoscaling contains autoscaling configuration parameters for this deployment

command.description: Command is the entrypoint command run in the container

cpu.description: CPU is the amount of CPU resource allocated to each replica in cores (fractional value is allowed)

created_at.description: CreatedAt is the ISO8601 timestamp when this deployment was created

description.description: Description provides a human-readable explanation of the deployment's purpose or content

desired_replicas.description: DesiredReplicas is the number of replicas that the orchestrator is targeting

environment_variables.description: EnvironmentVariables is a list of environment variables set in the container

name.description: Name is the environment variable name (e.g., "DATABASE_URL"). Must start with a letter or underscore, followed by letters, numbers, or underscores

value.description: Value is the plain text value for the environment variable. Use this for non-sensitive values. Either Value or ValueFromSecret must be set, but not both

value_from_secret.description: ValueFromSecret references a secret by name or ID to use as the value. Use this for sensitive values like API keys or passwords. Either Value or ValueFromSecret must be set, but not both

gpu_count.description: GPUCount is the number of GPUs allocated to each replica in this deployment

gpu_type.description: GPUType specifies the type of GPU requested (if any) for this deployment

health_check_path.description: HealthCheckPath is the HTTP path used for health checks of the application

id.description: ID is the unique identifier of the deployment

image.description: Image specifies the container image used for this deployment

max_replicas.description: MaxReplicas is the maximum number of replicas to run for this deployment

memory.description: Memory is the amount of memory allocated to each replica in GiB (fractional value is allowed)

min_replicas.description: MinReplicas is the minimum number of replicas to run for this deployment

name.description: Name is the name of the deployment

object.description: Object is the type identifier for this response (always "deployment")

port.description: Port is the container port that the deployment exposes

ready_replicas.description: ReadyReplicas is the current number of replicas that are in the Ready state

image.description: Image is the container image used for this replica

replica_ready_since.description: ReplicaReadySince is the timestamp when the replica became ready to serve traffic

replica_status.description: ReplicaStatus is the current status of the replica (e.g., "Running", "Waiting", "Terminated")

replica_status_message.description: ReplicaStatusMessage provides a human-readable message explaining the replica's status

replica_status_reason.description: ReplicaStatusReason provides a brief machine-readable reason for the replica's status

revision_id.description: RevisionID is the deployment revision ID associated with this replica

volume_preload_completed_at.description: VolumePreloadCompletedAt is the timestamp when the volume preload completed

volume_preload_started_at.description: VolumePreloadStartedAt is the timestamp when the volume preload started

volume_preload_status.description: VolumePreloadStatus is the status of the volume preload (e.g., "InProgress", "Completed", "Failed")

replica_events.description: ReplicaEvents is a mapping of replica names or IDs to their status events

status.description: Status represents the overall status of the deployment (e.g., Updating, Scaling, Ready, Failed)

storage.description: Storage is the amount of storage (in MB or units as defined by the platform) allocated to each replica

updated_at.description: UpdatedAt is the ISO8601 timestamp when this deployment was last updated

volumes.description: Volumes is a list of volume mounts for this deployment

mount_path.description: MountPath is the path in the container where the volume will be mounted (e.g., "/data")

name.description: Name is the name of the volume to mount. Must reference an existing volume by name or ID

object.description: Object is the type identifier for this response (always "list")
